definition: Having or displaying a friendly and pleasant manner.
mnemonic: Amiable sounds like 'am I able' to be friendly and kind? Yes!
visual_representation: Picture someone with a warm smile, greeting everyone cheerfully, symbolizing amiability.
example_sentence: The amiable shopkeeper always had a kind word for his customers.

definition: A fragrant ointment or preparation used to heal or soothe the skin; something that has a comforting, soothing, or restorative effect.
mnemonic: Balm sounds like 'calm,' indicating something that soothes or heals.
visual_representation: Picture someone applying a soothing ointment to their skin, symbolizing balm.
example_sentence: The cool breeze was a balm to the travelers after the scorching heat.

definition: The action or fact of forming a united whole; the sticking together of particles of the same substance.
mnemonic: Cohesion sounds like 'co-he-sion,' as in things 'co-' (together) and 'sion' (binding).
visual_representation: Picture a group of people holding hands in a circle, symbolizing unity and cohesion.
example_sentence: The team's cohesion was evident in how well they worked together.

definition: Lacking a coherent sequence or connection; disconnected.
mnemonic: Disjointed sounds like 'dis-joint-ed,' as if something has come apart at the joints.
visual_representation: Picture a puzzle with pieces scattered and not fitting together, symbolizing disjointedness.
example_sentence: The disjointed plot of the movie made it hard to follow the story.

definition: To criticize severely; to damage or remove part of the surface of (the skin).
mnemonic: Excoriate sounds like 'ex-core-iate,' as in attacking something to its core.
visual_representation: Picture a harsh critic tearing apart a book review, symbolizing excoriation.
example_sentence: The politician was excoriated by the press for his controversial remarks.

definition: The ability to produce an abundance of offspring or new growth; fertility.
mnemonic: Fecundity sounds like 'fecund-city,' indicating a city full of life and growth.
visual_representation: Picture a lush, green field full of thriving plants, symbolizing fecundity.
example_sentence: The fecundity of the soil made it ideal for farming.

definition: In a brave, spirited way; with determination.
mnemonic: Gamely sounds like 'game-ly,' as in approaching challenges as if ready to play and win a game.
visual_representation: Picture a runner determinedly finishing a race despite an injury, symbolizing gamely behavior.
example_sentence: Despite the challenges, she gamely continued her work without complaint.

definition: To deduce or conclude information from evidence and reasoning rather than from explicit statements.
mnemonic: Infer sounds like 'in-fur,' as in looking at fur to infer what kind of animal it is.
visual_representation: Picture someone piecing together clues to solve a mystery, symbolizing inference.
example_sentence: From her tone, I could infer that she was not happy with the decision.

definition: Rich and profuse in growth; lush.
mnemonic: Luxuriant sounds like 'luxury-ant,' as in something so rich and full, it feels like a luxury.
visual_representation: Picture a thick, green forest with abundant vegetation, symbolizing luxuriance.
example_sentence: The garden was filled with luxuriant vegetation and colorful flowers.

definition: A large painting or artwork done on a wall or ceiling.
mnemonic: Mural sounds like 'wall-art,' indicating a large painting on a wall.
visual_representation: Picture a vibrant painting covering the entire side of a building, symbolizing a mural.
example_sentence: The mural on the community center depicts the history of the neighborhood.

definition: A person qualified to make and supply eyeglasses and contact lenses for correction of vision.
mnemonic: Optician sounds like 'optic-ian,' as in someone who works with optics (glasses and lenses).
visual_representation: Picture a professional fitting glasses for a customer, symbolizing an optician.
example_sentence: The optician adjusted my glasses to fit perfectly.

definition: To fall or drop straight down at high speed.
mnemonic: Plummet sounds like 'plum-met,' as in something dropping like a heavy plum.
visual_representation: Picture a rock falling off a cliff, symbolizing plummeting.
example_sentence: The stock prices plummeted after the company's earnings report was released.

definition: Shy and fond of being on one's own; reserved.
mnemonic: Retiring sounds like 're-tire-ing,' as in someone who tires of social situations and prefers being alone.
visual_representation: Picture someone quietly reading a book alone at a party, symbolizing a retiring personality.
example_sentence: Despite his success, he was a quiet and retiring man who avoided the spotlight.

definition: Tending to induce drowsiness or sleep; a drug or other agent that induces sleep.
mnemonic: Soporific sounds like 'so-poor-ific,' as in something so boring it makes you sleepy.
visual_representation: Picture someone nodding off while reading a very dull book, symbolizing a soporific effect.
example_sentence: The professor's soporific lecture had half the class yawning within minutes.

definition: To move in a feeble or unsteady way; to be unstable.
mnemonic: Totter sounds like 'toddler,' as in a toddler who totters as they learn to walk.
visual_representation: Picture someone wobbling as they try to walk on a narrow beam, symbolizing tottering.
example_sentence: The old man tottered across the room with the help of a cane.

definition: To compete eagerly with someone in order to do or achieve something.
mnemonic: Vie sounds like 'vibe,' as in competing to have the best vibe or energy.
visual_representation: Picture two athletes sprinting toward the finish line, each trying to outdo the other, symbolizing vying.
example_sentence: Several companies are vying for the contract to build the new bridge.
